physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased levels of total alkaline phosphatase and 25-(OH)D with normal levels of calcium. A radionuclide bone scan showed intense tracer uptake in the pelvis, skull, and multiple ribs. Computed tomography confirmed pagetic bone at these sites and revealed a dorsal vertebral fracture. Dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry T-scores were -21.1 at the hip and -21.7 at the radius.
Normal levels of calcium in blood and urine; markedly increased values for 25-(OH)D. Elevated serum IgG4 levels (3.85 g/L), low CD19+–C38+–CD27+ plasmablast cell count (0.5% of CD19+ cells).
Confirmed elevated 25-(OH)D levels and increased values for 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D.
Normal 25-(OH)D levels and improved calcium levels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Normalization of 25-(OH)D and 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D concentrations was noted after decreasing tanning bed use.
Continued normalization of 25-(OH)D levels after the patient reduced tanning bed use.
